search_parameters.q: Ray Charles, age, music related skills + abilities + occupations, proficiency in each, and current residence location (city, state)

text_blocks.snippet: Ray Charles passed away on June 10, 2004, at the age of 73.

list.snippet: Primary Occupations: He was a singer, musician, songwriter, composer, and arranger. He is widely credited as the "Father of Soul" for pioneering the fusion of rhythm and blues with gospel music.
Vocals: Regarded as one of the greatest singers of all time, ranked #2 by Rolling Stone.
Piano/Keyboards: His primary instrument; he was a master of blues, jazz, and classical styles.
Alto Saxophone: Highly proficient; often featured in recordings with a style likened to Charlie Parker.
Other Instruments: He was a multi-instrumentalist who also played the clarinet, trumpet, organ, and occasionally drums and vibraphone.
Technical Skills: Expert at writing and arranging music in Braille and conducting big bands.

text_blocks.snippet: At the time of his death, Ray Charles lived in Beverly Hills, California. He was interred at the Inglewood Park Cemetery in Inglewood, California.
Would you like to know more about the specific awards he won or his influence on other genres like country music?
